title: Corporate Travel plans AGM technology demo
text:
In a company first, Corporate Travel Management is holding an “investor showcase event” at the completion of its annual general meeting in Brisbane on November 6.

Select shareholders are invited to “hear more about CTM’s focus for FY20 and beyond, as well as experience a demonstration of our travel technology developed by CTM’s in-house technology team”. What’s more, “the event will provide an opportunity to meet CTM’s global executive leadership team in person and take a deep dive into the unique opportunities of each regional market and their roadmaps for success”. And so hopefully distract from its earnings downgrade. But hurry, places are limited!

We do love it when Corporate Travel’s chief executive (and largest shareholder) Jamie Pherous talks – or promises to talk – about technology. It reminds us of chairman Ewen Crouch credulously maintaining to Chanticleer that Pherous is “not like other tech company CEOs”. Other tech company CEOs?!

Make no mistake, Corporate Travel Management is not a tech company.

Pherous’ head of partnerships, Scott Ward, told an industry webinar on September 12 that “we’ve got over 120 developers globally” and “there’s 40 developers who just sit in the Sydney office”. So software developers account for about 4.6 per cent of Corporate Travel’s total headcount of circa 2600.
description: Make no mistake, Corporate Travel Management is not a tech company.
